creator: jeremias@apache.org

text:
Avec plaisir, Jeremias! :) Sorry for the lack of comments, but I was a bit in a
hurry and eager to get something out of the door! For the missing part, it seems
I have messed a bit with the svn rm/svn add/svn diff interaction...

I just wanted to add that all one needs to build and run RTFLib is now:
 - commons-io-1.0.jar
 - commons-logging-1.0.3.jar
 - ...rtf.rtflib.**
 - ...rtf.TableContext
 - ...rtf.BuilderContext

Perhaps it would make sense to move the last two classes to the rtf.rtflib.tools
package? I can make it with a bit of help on the best svn way to do it, or leave
it to a committer with a svn-savvy refactoring IDE! ;)
If in a refactoring mood, the lonely rtflib.interfaces.ITableColumnsInfo may as
well move to rtflib.rtfdoc with all the other interfaces! ;)

Then why not provide a way to build a RTFLib.jar? Time for a 2nd patch for this
I guess...
creator: guillaume@anyware-tech.com
jeremias@apache.org
text:
I did the changes you suggested. About the separate JAR, you're welcome to 
provide a patch for the build. But I guess the whole RTF library will go to 
XML Graphics Commons anyway, which will make some build adjustments necessary 
again.

creator: guillaume@anyware-tech.com
text:
Thanks for your modifications Jeremias, it looks much cleaner now! :)

If a move to XML Graphics Commons is due soon, I will wait for it instead of
committing further patches.

For the sake of people reading only the last lines of the last entry of a bug,
let me sum all this up again: <MANTRA>all one needs to build and run a
FOP-independant RTFLib.jar is now:
 - commons-io-1.0.jar
 - commons-logging-1.0.3.jar
 - all classes in the org.apache.fop.render.rtf.rtflib package.
</MANTRA>
